title: Honoring Lyle W. Jones, Jr. upon the occasion of his retirement after 31 years of distinguished service to Otsego County
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION honoring Lyle W. Jones, Jr. upon the occasion of
his retirement after 31 years of distinguished service to Otsego County

WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative  Body  to  acknowledge  the
significant  milestones  in  the distinguished careers of esteemed resi-
dents of this noble Empire State; and
  WHEREAS, Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its  long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body is justly proud to honor Lyle
W.  ("Butch")  Jones,  Jr.  upon the occasion of his retirement after 31
years of distinguished service to Otsego County,  to  be  celebrated  on
February 14, 2011; and
  WHEREAS,  For  the  past  31  years,  "Butch" Jones rendered faithful,
conscientious and valuable service to Otsego County, earning the admira-
tion, esteem and affection of his colleagues; and
  WHEREAS, Lyle Jones began his career  in  public  safety  with  Otsego
County in 1980 as a dispatcher at the Otsego County Public Safety Commu-
nications  Center; in 1987, he became the communications center supervi-
sor holding the position until 1990  when  he  was  appointed  emergency
services coordinator; and
  WHEREAS, In addition, Lyle Jones serves as the county fire coordinator
and  regional  fire  administrator,  local  emergency planning committee
coordinator and is responsible for  overseeing  the  county  health  and
safety  office,  homeland security office and emergency medical services
training program; and
  WHEREAS, In his capacity as  county  emergency  services  coordinator,
"Butch"  Jones  served  with  loyalty,  honor  and  distinction, and was
governed by a keen sense of duty and always showed  a  unique  grasp  of
human problems in his official acts; and
  WHEREAS,  He has been blessed by his wife, Anita, who feels privileged
to be a part of his life and rejoices in his achievements; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body that  when  individ-
uals  of  such  noble aims and accomplishments are brought to our atten-
tion, they should be celebrated and recognized by all  the  citizens  of
the great State of New York; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor Lyle W. ("Butch") Jones, Jr. upon the occasion of  his  retirement
after  31  years  of  distinguished  service to Otsego County; and be it
further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Lyle W. Jones, Jr.
